description: {"blocks":[{"key":"bco88","text":"OriCiro® Cell-Free Cloning System is a rapid and powerful tool replacing cumbersome DNA cloning ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"an3dl","text":"(plasmid construction) process relying on E. coli. The system consists of two kits. OriCiro Assembly Kit allows seamless assembly of multiple overlapping DNA fragments. The assembly product can be added directly to OriCiro Amp Kit to get selective amplification of your target circular DNA (Figure 1). The amplified product is supercoiled DNA topologically identical to plasmid DNA isolated from E. coli. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":84,"length":20},{"style":"bold","offset":215,"length":16},{"style":"italic","offset":290,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bccr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2msva","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bsgmp","text":"1. OriCiro Assembly Kit: Multiple DNA fragments are assembled seamlessly at 42 ̊C for 30 minutes via ~40 bp overlapping ends (Figure 2). DNA fragments generated by PCR or restriction enzyme digestion are available. Our unique enzyme-based annealing mechanism allows powerful assembly up to 50 fragments simultaneously. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":125,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eh47q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eesed","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5vhu8","text":"2. OriCiro Amp Kit: The reaction consists of 26 purified enzymes involved in chromosome replication of E. coli. The chromosome replication cycle repeats autonomously at around 30 ̊C, enabling exponential amplification of circular DNA having oriC with extremely high fidelity (10-8 error/base/cycle) (Figure 3). The kit yields up to 1 μg circular DNA per 10 μL reaction at 33 ̊C for 6 hr. The maximum amplification size is 50 kb in the current version of the kit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20},{"style":"italic","offset":241,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":299,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92umi","text":"n.b. OriCiro Amp NEEDS oriC Cassette (0.4 kb) which can be inserted into circular DNA using OriCiro assembly kit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":114},{"style":"italic","offset":23,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f7u9m","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2rcr6","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ql6p","text":"References: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1oab5","text":"1. T. Mukai, T. Yoneji, K. Yamada, H. Fujita, S. Nara, M. Su'etsugu, Overcoming the Challenges of Megabase-Sized Plasmid Construction in Escherichia coli, ACS Synthetic Biology, 2020, 9 (6), 1315- 1327 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4djdi","text":"2. T. Hasebe, K. Narita, S. Hidaka, M. Su'etsugu, Efficient Arrangement of the Replication Fork Trap for In Vitro Propagation of Monomeric Circular DNA in the Chromosome-Replication Cycle Reaction. Life, 2018, 8 (43) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fjje","text":"3. M. Su’etsugu, H. Takada, T. Katayama, H. Tsujimoto, Exponential propagation of large circular DNA by reconstitution of a chromosome-replication cycle, Nucleic Acids Research, 2017, 45 (20), 11525– 11534 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhbvr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5hqbf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlp9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bbhl3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ud5f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"BFDD37702CC811EC8BEC676D45E78188","height":251,"id":176697,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Fig1.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnt5bkatp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnt3bkatp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnt4bkatp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnt2bkatp.webp","width":550}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"02E0FA702CC911EC8BEC676D45E78188","height":167,"id":176701,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Fig2.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnt9bkatp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnt7bkatp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnt8bkatp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnt6bkatp.webp","width":550}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3DFB49D02CC911EC8BEC676D45E78188","height":358,"id":176705,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Fig3.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnudbkatp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnubbkatp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnucbkatp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnuabkatp.webp","width":550}}}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"4jp0j","text":"a. Design and preparation of DNA fragments ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":43}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0924","text":"Each end of DNA fragments must have overlapping sequences which is typically introduced by PCR using tailed primers. For assembly of a smaller number of fragments, shorter overlap (~25 bp) is enough. Longer overlap (40-60 bp) can improve the assembly specificity and is particularly required for assembly of a larger number of fragments (\u003e10 fragments) or larger sized DNA (\u003e10 kb). Tm value does not have to be considered. The overlap ~10 bp away from the fragment end is acceptable. Restriction digested fragments with 5’ or 3’ sticky end are also available. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"af2up","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bnm5s","text":"b. Design and Preparation of your oriC cassette ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":48}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94cr9","text":"The oriC fragment having overlapping ends against your target fragments can be prepared by PCR using oriC Cassette (included in this kit) as a template, and primer pairs containing ~40 bp overlap sequences at their 5’tails. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f4ht0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bt9u2","text":"Typical primer sequence to amplify your oriC Cassette will be as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75fji","text":"Forward primer:5’-[~40 nt overlap for tail of your DNA fragment] +CTGCTCTGATGCCGCATAG-3′","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":66,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dmgtq","text":"Reverse primer: 5’-[~40 nt overlap for head of your DNA fragment (Reverse)] +GTGTCGGGGCTGGCTTAAC-3' ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":77,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15oij","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o8hj","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eqjef","text":"c. DNA quantity calculation for OriCiro Assembly Kit ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ajjcc","text":"Each DNA fragment should be added at equal molar ratio. The applicable amount of DNA fragments in the 5 μl assembly reaction is 1 pg - 20 ng as total fragments. Total 20 ng DNA is optimal for more than 10 fragments assembly. The amount of each DNA fragment is calculated by the following formula. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e1e7","text":"                    [Fragment size] / [Total assembly size] × [Total DNA amount (1 pg – 20 ng)] ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5fp0n","text":"As an example of assembly for two fragments; “oriC Cassette (0.4 kb)” and “Control Fragment (7.5 kb)”, where the “total assembly size” is 8 kb, the amount of each fragment should be as follows. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9euff","text":"                    oriC Cassette: 0.4 kb / 8 kb × 1 ng = 50 pg ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9aivs","text":"                    ControlFragment:7.5kb/8kb×1ng ≈ 1ng ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ofgo","text":"The equal molar ratio is important for the assembly of a larger number of fragments (\u003e10 fragments). In this case, we recommend use of DNA fragments with approximately equal length, whose concentrations are quantified precisely using fluorescence-based method (e.g., Q-bit, Thermo Fisher Scientific) or Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e2088","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f700t","text":"d. oriC Cassette (378 bp)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mot6","text":"     ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":1,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":2,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"tn5o","text":"e. Control Fragment (7.5 kb) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":29}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9lf11","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"51tb7","text":"Control Fragment was constructed by PCR amplification of the whole pBeloBAC11 plasmid using the following primers: 5’- CTATGCGGCATCAGAGCAG -3’ and 5’- GTTAAGCCAGCCCCGACAC -3’. The oriC Cassette will be inserted into a site downstream of the lacZa gene of pBeloBAC11. The resultant plasmid has oriC, BAC origin and a chloramphenicol-resistant gene, and is able to maintain the plasmid in E. coli after transformation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":39},{"style":"bold","offset":66,"length":108},{"style":"bold","offset":314,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"av2s4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"639qb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76co1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cspou","text":"  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8h4nu","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfr2n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"F3A283A02CCB11EC8BEC676D45E78188","height":106.79090909090912,"id":176713,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot 2021-10-14 at 17.51.12.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnumbkatp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnujbkatp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnukbkatp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnuibkatp.webp","width":245.75313807531387}},"1":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"9F8310402CCC11EC8BEC676D45E78188","height":199.88207547169793,"id":176717,"is_video":false,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"f6mj7","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"Screenshot keywords: cloning,plasmid amplification,cell-free cloning,DNA assembly,enzymatic reaction,enzymatic amplification,DNA amplification
materials_text:
{"blocks":[{"key":"bhh59","text":"I. Kit Components 
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e7kba","text":"OriCiro® Assembly Kit (for 5 reactions): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"t8q","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bdrsu","text":"OriCiro® Amp Kit (for 10 reactions): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":35,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"177v","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c3i4e","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3do0","text":"*1:  oriC Cassette is a 378 bp DNA fragment containing oriC (E. coli chromosomal origin) sequence. Both ends of the oriC Cassette have 40 bp overlapping sequences against Control Fragment (7.5 kb).  See Guidelines tab for sequence information. 
  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":245,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5phbl","text":"*2:  Extra volumes of 5X Buffer I and 5X Buffer II are added for optional Finalization reaction (see for Amplification Protocol). 
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2pt4h","text":"II. Equipment and materials required but not included","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":53}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4611r","text":"-  Nuclease-Free Water 
-  Vortex mixer 
-  Microcentrifuge 
- Thermal cycler or thermo block
- 0.2 ml microtubes (PCR tubes)
- Micropipettes (P-2, P-10) and tips 
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jf7p","text":"III. Storage ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"40bq4","text":"OriCiro® Cell-Free Cloning System is shipped on dry ice. Upon receipt, the kits must be immediately stored at below -70°C. 2X RA Mix and 10X RE Mix contains enzymes, and repeated freeze-thaws must be avoided, although at least three times freeze-thaws are possible without loss of the function. 10X RE Mix must be frozen quickly by liquid nitrogen or dry ice ethanol before storing again at -70°C. Although 2X RA Mix, oriC Cassette, Control Fragment, 5X Buffer I and 5X Buffer II can be stored at below -20°C, all components including 10X RE Mix can be stored together at below -70°C for convenience. 






","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["182","176"],"data":[["Component","Volume (μl)"],[" 2X RA Mix","12.5"],[" oriC Cassette *1 (50 pg/μl) ","10"],["Control Fragment *1 (1 ng/μl) "," 5"]],"guid":"3D0A3DA02CCA11EC8BEC676D45E78188","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"7461o","text":"    ","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}},"mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Component","Volume (μl)"],[" 2X RA Mix","12.5"],[" oriC Cassette *1 (50 pg/μl) ","10"],["Control Fragment *1 (1 ng/μl) "," 5"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{"A_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"},"B_1":{"className":"_dt-bold"}},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["179","179"],"data":[["Component","Volume (μl)"],["10X RE Mix ","10"],["5X Buffer I","40 μl *2"],["5X Buffer II "," 40 μl *2 "]],"guid":"AA140F202CCA11EC8BEC676D45E78188","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Component","Volume (μl)"],["10X RE Mix ","10"],["5X Buffer I","40 μl *2"],["5X Buffer II "," 40 μl *2 "]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"3E7A52F02CCB11EC8BEC676D45E78188","height":187,"id":176725,"is_video":false,"legend":"","mime":"image/png","nestedSelector":null,"original_name":"fig4.png","placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnuzbkatp.jpg","shadow":false,"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnuxbkatp.jpg","webp_placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnuybkatp.webp","webp_source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/fnuwbkatp.webp","width":550}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"etri","text":"Thaw 2X RA Mix on ice, mix it well with a vortex mixer at a maximum speed and spin down with a micro-centrifuge. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f1pek","text":"Turn on a thermal cycler or an air incubator and preheat at 33°C. \n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":66}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1s2tb","text":"Avoid evaporation of the reaction during incubation. If the thermal cycler is used, its lid should be set at 40°C. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cvqdg","text":"After 5X Buffer I and 5X Buffer II are thawed on ice, mix well with a vortex mixer and spin down with a microcentrifuge. After 10X RE Mix is thawed on ice, mix gently with the vortex mixer and spin down with the microcentrifuge. 



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":229}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5fltm","text":"Prepare the following pre-mixture on ice. Mix before and after the addition of 10X RE Mix as indicated. *1 

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":102}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3fc0l","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3jgsu","text":"
(*1): Use a 0.2ml PCR tube to avoid evaporation
(*2): Amp premixture for multiple reactions can be prepared as a single “master mix” by multiplying the volume of each reagent by the number of reactions. 
(*3): For the pipette mixing, set pipette volume to the total mixture volume, and pipetting up and down four times with agitation. 



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["159",100],"data":[["< Amp pre-mixture>","x1 reaction (*2)"],["Nuclease-Free Water","4μl"],["5X Buffer I","2μl"],["5X Buffer II                                        
       --> Vortex Mixing ","2μl"],["10X RE Mix                       
       --> Pipette mixing (*3) ","1μl"],["Total","9μl"]],"guid":"9C8822F02CD011EC8BEC676D45E78188","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["< Amp pre-mixture>","x1 reaction (*2)"],["Nuclease-Free Water","4μl"],["5X Buffer I","2μl"],["5X Buffer II                                        
       --> Vortex Mixing ","2μl"],["10X RE Mix                       
       --> Pipette mixing (*3) ","1μl"],["Total","9μl"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"343h1","text":"Prepare the following mixture on ice, and mix well by pipetting. (*1) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c2hlb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3l0cm","text":"Sample ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fg82","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1jghk","text":"Control ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4qoni","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9e5gb","text":"(*1): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"56c75","text":"• Use a 0.2 ml PCR tube to avoid evaporation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp55a","text":"• Vortex mixing is not recommended because of small volume of viscous sample. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"48rkr","text":"• For the pipette mixing, set pipette volume to the total mixture volume, and pipetting up and down four times with agitation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjm2j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"46c9j","text":" (*2): ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3864c","text":"• Include your intended oriC Cassette for the subsequent amplification reaction. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8s6rn","text":"• Each DNA fragment should be added at equal molar ratio. The applicable quantity of DNA fragments is 1 pg - 20 ng. The optimal quantity for more than 10 fragments assembly is 20 ng as total fragments. (see Appendix c. for the quantity calculation). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bkqeq","text":"• DNA fragment dissolved in TE buffer is acceptable. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["200","170"],"data":[["Nuclease-Free Water","2.5 - X μl"],["DNA Fragments (*2)                                   \n(up to 20 ng as total fragments)","X μl"],["2X RA Mix ","2.5 μl"],["Total ","5 μl"]],"guid":"056394602CCE11EC8BEC676D45E78188","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Nuclease-Free Water","2.5 - X μl"],["DNA Fragments (*2)                                   \n(up to 20 ng as total fragments)","X μl"],["2X RA Mix ","2.5 μl"],["Total ","5 μl"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23]}},"1":{"type":"tables","mutability":"","data":{"cellsMeta":{},"colTitles":["",""],"colWidths":["203","169"],"data":[["Nuclease-Free Water","0.5 μl"],["oriC Cassette (50 pg/μl)","1 μl"],["Control Fragment (1 ng/μl)","1 μl"],["2X RA Mix ","2.5 μl"],["Total ","5 μl"]],"guid":"5261D0B02CCE11EC8BEC676D45E78188","isJexcelDataFormat":true,"legend":"","mergeCells":{},"printData":[["Nuclease-Free Water","0.5 μl"],["oriC Cassette (50 pg/μl)","1 μl"],["Control Fragment (1 ng/μl)","1 μl"],["2X RA Mix ","2.5 μl"],["Total ","5 μl"]],"rowHeights":[23,23,23,23,23]}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bd6q7","text":" Incubate the mixture at 42°C (*3) for 30 minutes and hold on ice before use.(*4) \n (*3):  Needs 30-42°C \n (*4):  Although the assembly product can be stored at -4°C for a few days before the subsequent amplification step, i  mmediate use is recommended for best results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":82}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e1m24","text":"Optional Step (*5): Heat Treatment 

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ka2p","text":"Immediately after the 42°C incubation in step (3), transfer the mixture to 65°C block and heat it for 2 minutes, followed by quick cooling on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3tgik","text":"
(*5): “Heat treatment” can eliminate mis-assembly by products, and is recommended for the best results particularly when you intend to assembly a large number of fragments (over five fragments). 



","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b88in","text":"Check the amplified products using agarose gel electrophoresis.(*9)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":67}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3463r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e8kc9","text":"(*9):","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehs9j","text":"• Typical DNA concentration before Finalization option is 50-100 ng/μl 
• The gel-loading buffer should contain SDS etc. to remove proteins from DNA. 
• Because the product is supercoiled form, Supercoiled DNA Ladder (New England Biolabs) is recommended as a size maker. Alternatively, analyze it by restriction mapping. 
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hkm4","text":"The products can be stored at 4°C for several days. For long-term storage, add final 20 mM EDTA before storage at -20°C. Alternatively, purify the product with phenol/chloroform, followed by ethanol precipitation. 








","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: OriCiro® Cell-Free Cloning System/PASS V4.1.2
